NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024080541
item.description:
Report E-2024080541

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: NORRISTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and 10ft-by-10ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that approximately one-hundred and fifteen (115) gallons of material released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote due to a forklift puncture. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and placed the recovered spent absorbents into six (6) 40-gallon poly drums and three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. the generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor's demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080530
item.description:
Report E-2024080530

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 8, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnivroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Upon arrival, ES was notified that personnel for R+L carriers had deployed granular absorbents to the trailer interior and had station the damaged pail on the dock floor. ES personnel began by placing the damaged product pail into one (1) 55-gallon drum. They then utilized absorbent rags to clean and neutralize the dock floor. All spent absorbents were then placed into the same 55-gallon drum as the product pail.

item.title: Report E-2024080581
item.description:
Report E-2024080581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: BENSALEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one hundred and fifty (150) gallons of material released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote due to a forklift puncture. The remaining product was transferred to a new poly tote and deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used granular absorbents. The spent material was recovered and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024081406
item.description:
Report X-2024081406

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: READING
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell contacted safety to report that trailer 572156 caught on fire while on the 241/RDG yard. Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell stated that after ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck arrived at 241/RDG the lead trailer 572156 started smoking. ABF Road Driver Terry S chreck advised that after he arrived at 241/RDG he was about to unhook his set when he noticed the lead trailer 572156 was smoking. ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck advised that he then proceeded to disconnect rear trailer 500713 and converter gear 71708 from the lead trailer. ABF Road Driver Terry Sch reck advised that he then proceeded to move trailer 572156 to the middle of the yard before he disconnected the trailer from tractor 13383. ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck advised that after he disconnected trailer 572156 from the tractor the Reading Fire Department arrived on scene. Deputy Chief Glor e of the Reading Fire Department advised that he believes a pallet of Lithium Ion Batteries shifted during transit. Deputy Chief Glore advised that the battery post may have contacted metal causing them to arc igniting a pallet of writing pens that were incased in carboard that was loaded underneath the pallet of Lithium Ion Batteries. Deputy Chief Glore advised that the Reading Fire Department was able to put the fire out and made sure no drains or waterways were impacted. Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell advised he will send photos of the damage to safety. Safety contacted CURA and sp oke with Cameron Kerr to conduct cleanup procedures.
